\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 6295}

\subsection*{Some Words on After-Effects}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Pablo}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 &   &  & Pharms - Diazepam & \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 280.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}

I have recreationally used Valium on numerous occasions in doses ranging from 10mg up to 50mg.  Here are my conclusions:



- In doses of 10-20mg, Valium generally produces a mild euphoric buzz with a sense of calm, relaxtion, sedation and mild muscle relaxant qualities.  



- At doses higher than 20mg, I find that the buzz becomes too heavy \& sedating to enjoy - I just have a tendency to want to go to sleep.



- Using alcohol \& Valium in combo seems to just create a greater depressant effect.  A couple of drinks with a low dose of Valium - 10mg - seems OK \& a sensible limit to observe.  However, combining Valium with alcohol is a risky proposition.  LARGE quantities of alcohol \& Valium in combination could be serious - coma or even death in some cases.



-  One negative thing I would point out about Valium is the after effects.  I find that Valium, especially if used fairly regularly (several times a week), tends to build up in your system.  In technical terms, Valium has a half-life of approx. 40 hours and the major metabolite of Valium - desmethyldiazepam - has a half-life of 100 hours.  In laymans terms this means that Valium will hang around in your system, causing subtle active effects for several days after taking the drug.  What I find is that this causes a sense  of mild depression and a mild dulling of the senses which lasts for about 3-5 days. However, I know others who use Valium who say that they do not perceive any depressive/dulling effects at all. Your mileage may vary \ldots 

\end{document}
